value.title: Download/ Export Power Query data to csv, excel or txt - Power BI Tips & Tricks #25
value.excerpt: Do you want to export your power query data? In this video I show you how to do it :)  How to install R: https://goo.gl/g4wbEm BI accountant blog: https://goo.gl/lnjjxM Link to Power BI file: https://gofile.me/2kEOD/YPnFQZQ4c  R script: require(gdata) write.table(trim(dataset), file=”C:/writeyourfilepathhere/filename.txt”,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/56FV6x8vYyQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dynamically remove columns that contain a specific word in the header - Power Query
value.excerpt: It is very common when importing data from excel or pdfs that you get a lot of empty columns. In today's video I will show you how to remove those columns dynamically using power query.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power

value.title: Easily add query parameters to your source paths in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this tutorial, I show you how to easily add query parameters into your source paths using the advance editor function.  Chapter  00:00 Intro 00:40 Add data into power bi 01:30 Create a parameter 03:30 Add the parameter using advance setting Done!  Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center:

value.title: Fill up/ down with conditions in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to fill up or down based on conditions. I am going to show you two ways to do it, you pick the one need :)  Chapters 00:00 Intro 01:00 First solution using M language 02:50 Second solution using the UI Done!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Get data from zip files without extracting them in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today’s video, I will show you how to unzip files in Power BI. You will be able to import multiple zip files in Power Query and unzip them without having to extract them first.  Here is Marks blog, where you can find his function: http://sql10.blogspot.se/2016/06/reading-zip-files-in-powerquery-m.html

value.title: How to add ANNOTATIONS to a chart in Power BI to provide an explanation or more context!
value.excerpt: Annotations on charts are helpful for showing when key events occurred, especially when they have a noticeable impact on the data  or to give insights on the numbers in text form to help the reader understand the chart.  In todays video I will show you can you can add annotations to charts automatically

value.title: How to do Pagination without knowing the number of pages (Part 2) in Power Query | List.Generate

value.title: Insert blank rows at each category in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to have a blank row after each category or subcategory, so you can visualize your data in a table?   In this video I will show you how to add a blank row for each group using power query in one step!  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Insert text anywhere in a cell without adding a new column using the Power Query User Interface.
value.excerpt: There are no Insert functions ( that I know about) in the power query user interface, so if you dont know M, you probably have to create a new column to insert text in power query.  In today's video, I will show you how you can use power query user interface, to insert text into a column without adding

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.
